io.craigmiller160.school.service

Interface GenericEntityService

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    GenericEntityServiceBean
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SchoolDataService

    public interface GenericEntityService
    Interface for the service layer for the School Web Portal program. It performs additional operations on top of the basic CRUD operations of the DAOs. Like other service classes, implementations of this class can work with multiple DAOs and should provide transactional support.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    craig

    • Method Detail

      • updateEntity

        <T> void updateEntity(T entity)
        Save changes to an existing entity in the database.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of entity to update.
        Parameters:
        entity - the entity to update in the database.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the type of entity provided is not a supported entity by the database.

      • createEntity

        <T> T createEntity(java.lang.Class<T> entityType,
                   java.lang.Object... params)
        Convenience class for creating new instances of entities and inserting them into the database. This method will return an entity of the specified type, with values set to whatever fields are provided in the varargs params argument.

        NOTE: For the varargs params argument, the order of the arguments must match a constructor of the entity to be created. Not specifying all values is permitted, but the order must be maintained with null placeholder values.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of entity to create.
        Parameters:
        entityType - the type of entity to create.
        params - the values to set to the entity's fields.
        Returns:
        the created entity, having already been inserted into the database.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the type of entity provided is not a supported entity by the database.

      • insertEntity

        <T> void insertEntity(T entity)
        Insert the entity into the database. This is to be used with an entity that has not already been added, and an exception may be thrown if called on an entity that already exists.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of entity to insert.
        Parameters:
        entity - the entity to insert into the database.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the type of entity provided is not a supported entity by the database.
        java.lang.RuntimeException - a subclass of this exception is thrown if the entity already exists in the database.

      • deleteEntity

        <T> void deleteEntity(T entity)
        Delete an entity from the database. This is to be used with an entity that already exists in the database.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of entity to delete.
        Parameters:
        entity - the entity to delete.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the type of entity provided is not a supported entity by the database.
        java.lang.RuntimeException - a subclass of this exception is thrown if the entity already exists in the database.

      • deleteEntityById

        <T> void deleteEntityById(java.lang.Class<T> entityType,
                          int entityId)
        Delete an entity from the database, using its unique ID to determine which entity is to be deleted. This is a convenience method so that an entity can be deleted in a single transaction if an instance of it is not currently being handled by the program.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of entity to delete.
        Parameters:
        entityType - the type of entity to delete.
        entityId - the unique ID of the entity to be deleted.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the type of entity provided is not a supported entity by the database.
        java.lang.RuntimeException - a subclass of RuntimeException is thrown if this operation fails in some way.

      • getAllEntities

        <T> java.util.List<T> getAllEntities(java.lang.Class<T> entityType)
        Get a list of all persisted entities of the specified type.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of entity to get a list of.
        Parameters:
        entityType - the type of entity to get all records of.
        Returns:
        a list of all persisted entities of the specified type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the type of entity provided is not a supported entity by the database.

      • getEntityById

        <T> T getEntityById(java.lang.Class<T> entityType,
                    int entityId)
        Get an entity of the specified type from the database matching the provided id.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of entity to get.
        Parameters:
        entityType - the type of entity to retrieve.
        entityId - the id of the entity to retrieve.
        Returns:
        the entity of the specified type matching the provided id, or null if it doesn't exist.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the type of entity provided is not a supported entity by the database.

      • getEntityCount

        <T> long getEntityCount(java.lang.Class<T> entityType)
        Get a count of the total number of entities of the specified type that have been persisted in the database.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of entity to count.
        Parameters:
        entityType - the type of entity to get a count of.
        Returns:
        a count of the total number of entities of the specified type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the type of entity provided is not a supported entity by the database.
